challenge.title: Florida Man
challenge.desc:
It may be the farthest state away from Washington State, but that doesn’t mean we can’t recreate the crazy here in Seattle.

Have one of your team members do one of the following actual Florida Man actions:

  • Call a friend to report an imaginary friend missing
    • For the purpose of this task, call someone who is a friend who isn’t participating in this Transit Trek. Tell them you can’t find your imaginary friend. Make sure they know you are talking about an imaginary friend so they don’t think you’re dealing with an actual issue.
  • Attack someone with a banana
    • For the purpose of this task, please only “attack” a fellow Transit Trekker on your team who consents to it and please don’t actually hurt them. Common sense applies here.

Record it and send it to us. A man from Florida will decide whether your submission is acceptable or not.

challenge.title: Ped Xing
challenge.desc: There are many signs across Seattle honoring Michael Xing’s cousin Pedro, who’s known as Ped for short. Find three of them at least one mile apart from each other. Take a selfie with each of them and let us know their exact locations. The signs must clearly say “PED XING”. If you see the words “PED XING” written on the road, those unfortunately do not count.

challenge.title: Bigfoot
challenge.desc: Find three references to Bigfoot throughout Seattle, whether it’s a Bigfoot t-shirt in a store or a trinket or a billboard. Anything counts as long as someone else (who isn’t someone you know beforehand and isn’t affiliated with the Transit Trek) created it and it clearly depicts Bigfoot. Send us pictures to each reference (with the team members in the pictures).

challenge.title: This Ain’t Spokane
challenge.desc: Find a restaurant that exists in both Seattle and Spokane which share the same name but are otherwise not related to each other. Then visit its location in Seattle (or one of them, if there’s multiple), take a picture with it, and send us the info on the corresponding unrelated but similarly named restaurant in Spokane. The restaurants must serve similar food.

challenge.title: You Spokan’t Say It Like That
challenge.desc: Try to get a passer-by to say Spokane in the most common mispronunciation. Have one team member open their voice memo recording app. Have another team member write the word “Spokane” on their phone’s notes app, identify some passer-bys whom you do not know, and approach them. Start recording, show them your notes app, and ask them how they pronounce that word. You must record until one of the passers-by erroneously says that Spokane is pronounced spow-KAYN like “cane” (it’s actually pronounced spow-CAN, pronounced like “can”). Make a new recording for each person you ask. Send this recording to us; it must contain you asking them to pronounce the word. If you feed them the incorrect pronunciation, whether inadvertently or intentionally, that person’s response is disqualified and you must try again with someone else.

challenge.title: Nudist Beach
challenge.desc: Find a nudist beach within two miles of the Governor Albert D. Rosellini Bridge (on the Seattle side, of course). Take a selfie showing that you were there, but please take care to ensure your selfie does not include anyone nude.

challenge.title: 520 at 5:20
challenge.desc: At 5:19pm PDT, send us a message requesting a secret code. Be on the 520 Bridge’s pedestrian walkway at 5:20pm PDT exactly. (Simply entering the walkway does not count; your feet must be above the waters of Lake Washington. Also, the Arboretum Waterfront Trail does not count.) You must send us your exact location and a selfie proving it; both Lake Washington and the bridge must be visible in your selfie. Also be sure your selfie has one team member’s phone showing the secret code. The selfie must be sent to us by 5:22pm PDT.

challenge.title: Vegan Thai
challenge.desc: Visit two different vegan Thai restaurants. They must be fully vegan; you must be able to prove definitively to us that they are vegan. They cannot be two different locations of the same chain. Send us selfies proving this.

challenge.title: Don't Be Curt, Be Kurt-eous
challenge.desc:
Earn up to 5 points for this challenge! Read more to find out how.

Retrace the steps of Nirvana frontman Kurt Cobain by visiting at least two places listed in a New York Times article about following in Cobain’s footsteps, published in 2014:

  • Central Saloon, 207 First Avenue South, Seattle; 206-622-0209; centralsaloon.com.
  • The Crocodile, 2200 Second Avenue, Seattle; 206-441-4618; thecrocodile.com.
  • Viretta Park, next to 171 Lake Washington Boulevard, Seattle.
  • Linda’s Tavern, 707 East Pine Street, Seattle. This homey pub, nicknamed the “Grunge Cheers” is the last place Kurt Cobain was seen alive. Friends gathered at Linda’s to mourn his loss, and the owner refused to let MTV and others come inside to film the place.
  • Cactus, 4220 East Madison Street, Seattle. This popular Southwestern restaurant, said to be one of Cobain’s favorite dining spots, was one of the last places he was seen alive. WARNING: This must be the exact Cactus location in Madison Park; it cannot be another one.

Get 2 extra points when you buy something for less than $5 and leave it on the bench in Viretta Park that’s closest to his old house.

(If you are interested in reading it: Chasing Kurt Cobain in Washington State - The New York Times)

challenge.title: Diluting the Salty Sea
challenge.desc: Buy a paper or plastic cup without a lid that has at least 10 oz of capacity. Fill it up at least ¾ of the way with water from Lake Union or Lake Washington and deposit it all in Puget Sound. At least ½ of the cup of water must remain by the time the cup reaches Puget Sound. The water must remain in this very cup unless the cup is about to leak, in which case it’s okay to replace it with another paper or plastic cup without a lid that can store at least 10 oz of water. If the cup spills over ⅓ of its contents before it reaches Puget Sound, you must start over. Take a video of a member scooping water from the freshwater lakes and take another video of them depositing the water in Puget Sound.

challenge.title: Bring the Beans Back to the Roastery
challenge.desc: Buy a drink from a Starbucks west of Interstate 5. Then bring it to the Starbucks Reserve Roastery and consume it. Take a video of you picking it up from the Starbucks and then of you consuming it from within the Starbucks Reserve Roastery. Feel free to consume it on the way there but you need to at least take your last sip at the Reserve Roastery.

challenge.title: It's Pronounced Catan
challenge.desc: Find a store that sells Settlers of Catan and take a selfie with it. Bonus points if you can find a sign that says “it’s pronounced Catan”.

challenge.title: Bilt Rent Day is a SCAM. They advertise it as 6% back but in reality it's 3% back twice! Does this make a difference? YES. E.G. a $19.52 transaction gets 58 points because they round down from 58.5, on rent day rather than giving 6% which should be 117 points they give 3% (rounded down) twice. So you only get 116 points. This is fraud and I am outraged
challenge.desc: Find an item priced such that the price multiplied by 3, rounded down to the nearest dollar, then doubled again is strictly less than the price multiplied by 6 rounded down to the nearest dollar.

challenge.title: Pay a Toll to the Troll
challenge.desc: Go visit the Troll and take a picture of one team member holding out their ORCA card to the Troll.

challenge.title: Banksy
challenge.desc: Find an artwork that resembles a Banksy work of art. Send us both a photo of the artwork in Seattle and a link to the Banksy work of art that it resembles.

challenge.title: I Like Edging
challenge.desc: Find two businesses in Seattle whose names start with “Edge”. Go within 200 feet of them and take a selfie with the respective building.
challenge.privateNotes: What we have in mind: Edgeworks and Edgewater Hotel

challenge.title: The Diplomat
challenge.desc:
Find three consulates general in the Seattle area within the game zone. If they are located in a building that is closed, being as close to the building as possible without trespassing will count for full credit.

Important note: Honorary consulates, as well as any consulate which is not named a “consulate general”, will not count.
challenge.privateNotes:
Explicitly OK:
Canada
India
Japan
South Korea (Republic of Korea)

NOT OK:
Belgium
El Salvador
France
Germany
Mexico
Taiwan

challenge.title: Big Percentage of Seattle
challenge.desc: Former President Trump claimed during the 2024 ABC presidential debate that protesters “took over a big percentage of the city of Seattle”. Find a reservoir within the “big percentage” of the city that was taken over by protesters during the 2020 protests.

challenge.title: I Can't Sleep in a Houseboat ffs
challenge.desc: Find the houseboat featured in the film Sleepless in Seattle.

challenge.title: Gamer
challenge.desc: At Blue Highway Games, find two of the games recommended by the staff, as denoted here: https://www.bluehighwaygames.com/shop/game-recommendations/staff-picks-of-the-month/. You may NOT ask for help with finding the games.

challenge.title: Rubber Chicken
challenge.desc: Find a rubber chicken museum in Wallingford and take a picture with at least three rubber chickens in the same photo.

challenge.title: On Kracke
challenge.desc: Take a picture of the Seattle skyline from Bhy Kracke Park.

challenge.title: Sports Fan
challenge.desc: Go within 50 feet of the perimeter of a stadium home to a Seattle major professional sports team belonging to one of the following leagues: NFL, MLB, NHL, MLS. Take a team selfie there.

challenge.title: Lyrics Challenge 3
challenge.desc:
Challenge Jeffrey’s ability to recall lyrics by sending him two distinct and contiguous lines from the song comprising at least 10 distinct words. (Oohs and ahhs and other mumblings in the song do not count.) Send it to Game Control in the Signal chat, who will then pass it on to Jeffrey. He will be given 15 seconds to guess it. If he fails to guess it correctly, you get 1 point. No points are given or deducted if he guesses it correctly. You only get one try, so choose wisely!

Example of an acceptable lyric to send (from “(Don’t Fear) The Reaper”):

“Seasons don't fear the reaper / Nor do the wind, the sun or the rain”

Examples of unacceptable submissions (from “(Don’t Fear) The Reaper”):

  1. “the reaper / Nor do the wind, the sun or the rain / We can be”
  2. “40,000 men and women everyday / 40,000 men and women everyday”
  3. “La, la, la, la, la / La, la, la, la, la”

Songs to choose from:

  • Audioslave - Like A Stone

  • Gims - Tu vas me manquer

challenge.title: Burpee and Slurpee
challenge.desc: Find a 7-Eleven and have one team member do ten burpees. (Film this.) A burpee is defined as a push up followed by a jumping jack. Then buy a Slurpee inside and take a picture of the same team member drinking the Slurpee as a reward.

challenge.title: Find Jeffrey
challenge.desc:
Caution: Depending on how the game goes, this challenge might not occur. Stay tuned to Signal for the latest info.

Find Jeffrey in Seattle between 3pm and 4:30pm. His location will be shared on the main Signal chat in the form of a clue. He will be stationary. He could be anywhere in the game area.

Map of game area: https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/edit?mid=1VTRXC-T_dsomkPm0d4DNd_vsrOc9nAA&usp=sharing

challenge.title: Pricey Pike Place
challenge.desc: Find a restaurant in Pike Place that serves a dish costing more than $50 per plate.
challenge.privateNotes: Matt's In The Market is one example

find.title: Find Me #3
find.privateNotes:
"Biography of a Branch" by Deborah Mersky
Fisher Pavilion, 305 Harrison St, Seattle, WA 98109
